text:
The text outlines three parallel cortico-basal ganglia-thalamo-cortical loops:
1.  **Body movement loop:** Involves primary motor, premotor, and supplementary motor cortices, putamen, pallidum, and ventral lateral/anterior thalamic nuclei, returning to motor/somatosensory cortex.
2.  **Prefrontal loop:** Connects the dorsolateral prefrontal cortex, anterior caudate, pallidum, and mediodorsal/ventral anterior thalamic nuclei, projecting back to the prefrontal cortex.
3.  **Limbic loop:** Links anterior cingulate/orbitofrontal cortex (and other limbic regions) to the ventral striatum (nucleus accumbens), ventral pallidum, and mediodorsal thalamic nucleus, returning to limbic cortical targets.

These distinct loops are specialized for motor control, executive functions, and emotion/motivation, respectively.
